results.title: Matisse & the Fauves
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau Inc
results.brief_description: Documents the search of Henri Matisse and other painters for a greater intensity of colour based upon their belief that the impact of a painting comes from its coloured surface. Shows Matisse’s developing use of bold, simplified brushwork and brilliant unnatural colour.

results.title: Matina Horner: portrait of a person
results.brief_description: Matina Horner is the sixth president of Radliffe College, Massachusetts, whose main concern is with the future of women in the university. Mrs. Horner comments on the administration of institutions such as Radcliffe and Harvard, about young women and young people in general, and the role of educational institutions. Focusing on her Greek heritage shows her early years through photographs and home movies. Includes some animation.

results.title: Matilda country
results.brief_description: Winton is an isolated town in central Queensland, whose history is associated with the writing of the song “Waltzing Matilda” by Banjo Patterson in 1895. Several people of the district including the postmaster, a woman on a station, a station owner and a truck driver, talk about life at Winton. The work of the mail contractor and post office are shown. Devised by Rob Gerrand for Australia Post.

results.title: Matilda
results.creator_credit: Danny DeVito, Liccy Dahl, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Matilda Wormwood (Mara Wilson) is a very special girl with an unfortunate family. While her elder brother goes to school, (Matilda doesn’t go to school because her parents think she is 2 years younger than she actually is), her father goes to work as a shonky car salesman (he’s being investigated by the FBI) and her mother plays bingo, Matilda educates herself at the local library. Reading provides her with some assurance that she’s not alone, but she longs to go to school and meet other children. Matilda’s loneliness disappears when she begins school; she makes friends and has a lovely teacher, Miss Honey. The only problem is Miss Honey’s horrible aunt, Trunchbowl, headmistress of the school. Matilda is drawn to the kind Miss Honey and together they set about changing their unhappy lives so that they’re both in a loving family. With Matilda’s magic power that allow her to move objects, anything is possible. Look out nasty parents and evil Trunchbowl! Based on the book by Roald Dahl this is a heartwarming story about how life can change for the better. Starring Mara Wilson, Danny DeVito, Rhea Perlman, Embeth Davidtz and Pam Ferris.

results.title: Mathsphere 2
results.brief_description: Mathsphere aims to bring the real world into the classroom. By placing mathematics in a real context, for example, the examination of environmental issues, the objective is to see mathematics as a human activity. Each episode is in two parts with a corresponding mathematical process or activity. Exercises and data are provided in the accompanying booklet. Topics include manipulating data, percentages and ratios, spreadsheets, geometry, algebra, trigonometry, statistical methodologies and fractions. The programs are pitched so that they can be applied to different levels of study.

results.title: Mathsphere
results.brief_description: These videos present maths problems that may be encountered in the real world. Mathematical techniques and their applications are shown hand in hand giving relevance to a variety of topics. Areas covered include collecting and presenting data, estimating, measuring and accuracy, scale and enlargement, probability, plans and elevations. The video includes a special ‘Mathsphere activity pack’.

results.title: Maths with everything (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Krish, John Arnold and A Graphic Film
results.brief_description: Demonstrates British child centred methods of teaching mathematics to children aged five to seven. The film’s point is that maths includes all activities if teachers know where to look for opportunities to teach it, using experiences that interest and totally involve the children. Writer John Krish for the Nuffield Mathematics Teaching Project. Explores thematic approach to mathematics. Begins with an in-service program for infant teachers. They construct a mural and then proceed to discover maths in it. A class teacher in a school situation then adopts the same approach using the theme ‘buses’.
